comment.author: 82173624@N00
comment._content: Does anybody know where this is?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It looks like Sydney Harbour (not a river as in the title) looking west towards Balmoral/Mosman, taken from Darley Road in Manly, somewhere near where the Manly Hospital now is.  I have been trying to find the house on Google Maps without luck.

comment.author: 29242971@N02
comment._content: Is the slide image in the correct orientation?  The "54" in the top corner is backwards.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The image is correct msmichls01.  A lot of these glass negatives have writing on the reverse of the plates (see Persistent URL).  I imagine it is something to do with the cataloguing system of the photographer, and would not have shown up in a cropped print or framing mount.

comment.author: 39165494@N06
comment._content: This photo was taken from Osborne Road,Manly looking south-west down an unmade Marshall Street to Wood St. and out over Little Manly Cove(not Spring Cove) with Manly Point(then known as Smedley's Point )and  Sydney Harbour in the background.The Little Manly Wharf c1887,the Council gas lamp in Osborne Rd. and the grand houses,Ashbourne c 1890(cnr Wood and Marshall Sts),Uyeno c1883 and Maretimo c1885-86(both in Addison Road)help date the photo to around 1900-1910.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think you are right karmazone - I was looking at the next bay over - well done!

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This photo is taken from the top of manly somewhere near the hospital look west to balmoral.  The big flat topped hill on the right is where Tania Park is,  the shape of the two headlands in front of it are quite distinctive.
